title: Repercussions for false reports?
body:
So do Riot do anything with these people that make up lies about team mates abusing the entire team then begging the other team to report?

Just had a guy in my game outright lie about me abusing my entire team then begged the enemy team to report.

I did nothing remotely close to abusing my team or even remotely close to negative attitude so I am not worried  about my account standing but there should be some repercussions for outright false reporting, lies and begging the other team to report based on nothing.

The liar was petarghhh .

replies.body: Every time they make false reports the person's credibility in the system decreases, to a point they just don't exist and are unable to meaningfully report, their reports will then have absolutely no weight and have no contribution to any bans.

From what I understand, this has actually changed and report credibility is now done with the individual report, rather than a player having an overall "report weight".

That said, reporting someone who asks other players to report someone on baseless ground *might* be a punishable offence. I'll see what I can find on that.

EDIT: Quick update, it seems that asking for reports is only punishable if it's used as a "leaping off" point for harassment. You can read more about this from Riot NaKyle's post regarding the subject: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/PzY1ArN3-we-dont-ban-people-for-asking-for-reports

That's a much older post, from about a year ago, whereas Riot NaKyle's statement on the subject was 3 month ago. To be clear (and to quote [Riot Tantrum](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/1NGnychF-plz-contact-me-riot?comment=0001000000000000000000000000) from the same thread I linked) "A single 'report xx' isn't going to cause a penalty. But calling someone a feeder for having a poor game, telling people to report them for int'ing, etc .. is all going to be considered negative."

Hope that helps clear things up.

Great responses :) For clarification, report weight was initially used to aid the system in identifying false reports, but now that the learning system has matured such a system is no longer necessary. What this means is that even if you're an ass who reports falsely or out of spite a lot, the one time you do report validly it will actually count. That said, nothing has really changed, a false report is just as meaningless now as it was previously.

Hey i thought i would post seeing this really does annoy me, i just played a game in blind pick and because i connect slower i couldn't call a lane leaving adc which i hate with passion so much, i told my team i was not capable of playing  adc  and if i had to go bot i would be playing [champ] , to which people said they don't mind. So i get in game and [support] support instantly starts taking all the cs so i left lane and tried to proxy it, at this point the support is calling me a troll and many other words, to which i reply you forced me bot lane you would not let me support and its not called adc it's called bottom now for a reason ,and now you stop me from csing. Anyway all lanes lost and game finished quite fast but towards end of game 3 people in my game start spamming all chat saying please 9x report the troll, which i ended up getting chat banned for 10 games over now please explain to me how this is fair at all riot? i assume i got 10 game ban seeing recently my mac client was playing up causing me to dc like 4 games in a row which punished me then, but i mean how did i deserve 10 game chat ban seriously not spending any money on this game until things like these are fixed i was literally banned minutes after i got reported, so who the hell managed to look over the case and ban me in a couple minutes ? cause any one with a brain can clearly see i did not deserve to be punished over it.
As should have been made fairly clear from the comments on this post, false reports don't mean anything. You won't be punished if you didn't do anything punishable.
